titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to Institute of International Finance Press Clippings MC.79
titlestmt.author: Leslie Barnes

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2021-01-21 14:32:37 -0500.

change.item: Edited by Jennifer E. Neal for compliance with DACS and ACM Required Elements for Archival Description

did.unittitle: Institute of International Finance Press Clippings
did.abstract: The Investment Bankers Association of America, in cooperation with New York University, founded the Institute of International Finance in 1926 as a fact-finding body concerned with foreign economic and financial conditions. This collection contains a scrapbook of press clippings that mention the Institute of International Finance from between 1927 and 1939 and "The Bulletins of NYU's Institute of Finance, 1926-1970: A Review Article," reprinted from the Journal of Economic Literature.
did.physloc: Materials are stored offsite and advance notice is required for use. Please request materials at least two business days prior to your research visit to coordinate access.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Materials found in collection; provenance is unknown.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Investment Bankers Association of America, in cooperation with New York University, founded the Institute of International Finance in 1926 as a fact-finding body concerned with foreign economic and financial conditions. John T. Madden, the Dean of New York University's School of Commerce, Accounts, and Finance directed the Institute. The Institute published Bulletins, answered inquiries, developed a finance library, and published studies about foreign economic conditions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Institute of International Finance, Press Clippings; MC 79; box number; folder number; New York University Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing decisions made prior to December 2018 were not recorded.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection includes a scrapbook that contains clippings from various sources including news organizations, newspapers, and pamphlets, from between 1927 and 1939 that mention the Institute of International Finance. Each item is labeled with its source and date. "The Bulletins of NYU's Institute of Finance, 1926-1970: A Review Article," by Samuel Katz, reprinted from the Journal of Economic Literature, is in the same box as the scrapbook.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: This collection is protected by copyright and/or related rights. You are free to use materials in the collection in any way that is permitted by the copyright and related rights legislation that applies to your use. For other uses you need to obtain permission from the rights-holder(s).
